##Where are the supplies? Wuhan Red Society Can Not Answer the question, blockchain can

Micro-signal Xinlianjiie -

Function introduction, explore the value of industrial blockchain

By Wang Qiao

Editor / Solo
The header image is from the web

Editor / Solo

The header image is from the web

The beginning of the New Year, the National War "epidemic" , confirmed cases are increasing day by day, from hundreds, thousands, tens of thousands, the increase of the number affects the hearts of every Chinese. All kinds of relief materials have arrived in Wuhan, however, materials piled up in the warehouse of the Wuhan Red Cross Society, delayed delivery.

The death of life-saving medical supplies stuck in the "last mile" is undoubtedly the most painful.

The reason is the low efficiency of material management and the lack of transparency of information. A large number of goods and materials for the Red Cross in a short period of time has been "beyond the outline examination questions" , the public for the donation of goods and materials do not know, it is even worse.

In response to the Red Cross's internal inefficiency, management chaos and unfair distribution, Liu Mingrui told Zinc.com that the spread of the "virus" has "exponential" power, the Red Cross has struggled to cope with exponential crises with backward "LINEAR" systems. Moreover, the spread of "viruses" is often highly uncertain, complex and time-sensitive.

Where are the supplies? This Wuhan Red Society Can Not Answer the question, blockchain and other technologies may be.

"In essence, the distribution of materials and the push of information are similar, " said Shen Yang, a professor at the School of Journalism and communication at Tsinghua University and one of China's top microbloggers. Information Push has come to the era of intelligent recommendation, and the distribution of materials should also be introduced AI, blockchain, cloud computing and big data (ABCD) , and full-effect Holographic full staff can query.

Material information on the chain

First, the consistent lack of transparency has led to a serious lack of credit for the Red Cross. Only when the data are transparent will it be easier for the public to monitor and find out whether the allocations are genuine, whether the allocation process is fast and whether the results are fair.

Xuan Hongliang, founder of WeSpace trusted digital ecology, told zinc links that blockchains are a "self-validating" system. Any organization that provides a public service or produces or sells products, dares to put the core data on the chain, showing that it dares to "prove its innocence" ; does not dare to put on the chain, once the mistakes in the work are made public, it will certainly encounter more public suspicion.

He believes that cloud computing and blockchain technology can be used to build a credible medical materials management system, promote medical materials management model innovation. Namely in the original management pattern foundation, increases the key node core data to sign on the chain link. Through the cooperation of cloud chain, the cloud is responsible for data calculation, evidence storage and data query, the chain is responsible for trusted data and trusted evidence storage and verification, the client provides data collection and cloud chain interaction, to create a new and credible system of public service.

Second, to solve the problem of distribution of medical supplies, the whole process must be completely open, whether donors, the public or the demand side, can clearly see the flow of each material, so that each material can be put into practice.

"We need to get the front end and the back end of the data open, " Tang Bo, chief scientist at Changhong Information Security Laboratory, told zinclink. "We need to make the donation data and distribution data public. The participating roles include donors, distributors and supervisors. Secondly, we need to clarify their respective rights and obligations and enforce them systematically. "

According to the Beijing News, Zhang Nandi Yang, director of the Qingdao Branch of the National Institute of Development and Strategic Studies at Renmin University of China and an associate professor at the School of Public Administration, also believes that in resource allocation, it is difficult for traditional technology to realize the real-time information sharing and opening of social resources across departments and fields.

"In the face of the public health crisis, we have used blockchain technology to build material chains, to integrate data on available materials from all sectors of society, and to track material production, inventory and transportation in real time across the country. Block chain technology, materials origin, direction, detention, distribution can be in the chain of real-time accounting, multi-point data storage, and to the public. The distribution of goods and materials is clearly visible, and the whole society can work together to supervise, improve the efficiency of resource allocation and enhance mutual trust."

Recently, interesting chain technology will join Haier Zhijia, China Xiongan Group and other enterprises began research and development of "donated materials traceability platform. ".

It is envisaged that many institutions, both domestic and foreign, will be located on the platform, and whenever a person or an institution wishes to donate a batch of goods to an institution, it will simply register on the platform, you can see the whole process of donation details, logistics tracking, material receiving, material implementation, and so on. Moreover, you can also see the dynamic demand in real time. The whole process can be traced back to its source and is difficult to tamper with, to solve the "demand difficult voice, donation difficult in place, the masses hard to believe" the three major problems.

The project is expected to go live in February, according to Zink.

In addition, the Internet of things technology is needed to make the whole process open and transparent. Yuan Dongyang, director of Germany's intelligent chain financial research office, told zinclink that combining information about the types, quantities, distribution requirements, recipients, distribution requirements and the results after distribution, as well as relying on the Internet of things to collect material displacement, time and status information on the chain, and open to the distributor, recipient, government agencies, logistics companies and other entities, to achieve data sharing and comparison, it can ensure that all the information about material distribution is transparent, timely and true to all parties, avoid material loss, mismatch, improve the timeliness and accuracy of material distribution.

From a technical point of view, the blockchain can indeed be open and transparent, but there are organizational, institutional and legal issues, according to Mao Zhihong, founder and CEO of Arcblock. It systems are for people, especially when IT comes to systems like donating supplies, first of all, make sure that the data itself is accurate, that IT makes sense to put IT on the chain, and second of all, make sure that the execution is in place, that the chain can only guarantee the state of the chain, there is no guarantee that it will be carried out.

Digital ID, smart matching supplies

After the whole process of medical materials is open and transparent, a legal digital identity certificate will be issued to the demand and supply units of medical materials, making the published information on demand and supply real and effective, so that the real demand can be matched reasonably and correctly, to get the most out of medical supplies.

Yuan Yunliang, technical director of German chain intelligence, told zinclink that medical material demand units and supply units should be given legal digital identities, and medical material demand units should be linked to the chain according to categories, numbers, quality and other dimensions, the medical material supply unit will supply the material information according to the corresponding dimension on the chain, on-line intelligent matching, the material point-to-point distribution, the full link source, and introduce the supervision department to carry on the audit. The demand side and the supply side maintain and update the data daily, the whole material distribution process is transparent and efficient, and the reasonable and correct distribution of medical material is accelerated.

Yuan added that only those with legal digital identity certificates can use the platform to release demand, provide supply information, prevent illegal and untrue demand and supply information, and ensure the accuracy of information. Secondly, intelligent matching, point-to-point distribution, can not go through the middle (Wuhan Red Cross Society) .

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Image Credit: Author

The supply side will connect directly with the demand side, and the demand will be better understood and the material will be distributed more quickly.

An exponential crisis requires an "exponential organization"

What is needed to deal with an exponential crisis is a more efficient and resilient system for the future. As Salim Ismail of Singularity University points out in his book the Exponential Organization, I think the core of the future system is self organization, community and Mass, information credibility and Web Synergy. The untamper-able, traceable, and fully transparent nature of blockchain technology could play a central role in future systems.

Liu Mingrui told zinclink: "In the past, the standard of a strong system was how much resources it had. In the future, the standard of a strong system is how to make resources flow efficiently. ". Even if a traditional organization like the Red Cross has more resources, if it can not transfer them efficiently, it is not a strong system to deal with the crisis.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Photo: Courtesy of the respondents

Every exponential organization has a big, transformative goal, and when it has a big goal, the conflict within the organization is reduced and it becomes a consensus. Second, exponential organizations don't have large numbers of employees, but they do have large numbers of people at work, and the most valuable things are provided by communities and the general public. You don't need to have your own professionals, you just need to give them a platform where the community and the public can contribute a lot.

In the future, power will shift from the core to the periphery. In the future, what is needed to deal with social uncertainty is a new type of organisation that is empowered by a new generation of information technologies."

In this outbreak, the power of technology is everywhere.

For example, at Wuhan's Huoshenshan Hospital, Huawei cooperated with the three major operators to set up a 45g wireless network and a dedicated line network in only four days; AI also became an important support force for front-line medical personnel, the Ai Algorithm, developed by the Alidamo Institute, can reduce the number of hours of genetic analysis of suspected cases to half an hour, significantly reducing the diagnostic time, and accurately detect changes in the virus; in addition, in order to further speed up the development and marketing of new vaccines and drugs, Bat and many other domestic technology companies have opened their AI computing power free of charge to scientific research institutions.

However, technology participation is still far from adequate. Wuhan Red Society is a typical example, no matter how loud the slogan of Digital Economy is, the "short board" at the critical moment is enough to expose the problems of digital popularization.

We hope that when we face the same difficulties again, there will be more technology to help: There are blockchain technology to help information transparency; there is the Internet of things to track the flow of medical supplies, for the authenticity of the link data; There is cloud computing, which makes rapid calculations of vast amounts of data; and there is the legal digital identity of demand and supply units of medical supplies, which matches demand reasonably and maximizes the utility of medical supplies.
